name: Surtalogi
desc: One of the Five Sinners of Khaenri'ah, also known as "The Foul."

customize.text: Surtalogi is one of the six people who should have prevented the disaster in Khaenri'ah and stopped the Vinster King from continuing to rock the foundation of the world.

customize.name: Hroptatyr
customize.desc: One of the Five Sinners of Khaenri'ah, also known as "The Wise."

customize.name: Vedrfolnir
customize.desc: One of the Five Sinners of Khaenri'ah, also known as "The Visionary."

customize.name: Rerir
customize.desc: One of the Five Sinners of Khaenri'ah, also known as "RÃ¤cher of Solnari."

customize.name: Rhinedottir
customize.desc: An alchemist, a member of the Hexenzirkel, one of the five Sinners of Khaenri'ah, and Albedo's mother. Rhinedottir created an army of shadowy monsters, who attacked Teyvat 500 years ago. She's also known as Gold and R.

customize.text: Together with Surtalogi, they couldn't resist the call of the Abyss and divided among themselves a power that could destroy the world. They became the Five Sinners, transcendent beings with a world-shattering power.

customize.name: Skirk
customize.desc: A mysterious swordswoman from the Abyss and Tartaglia's master.

customize.name: All-Devouring Narwhal
customize.desc:
A mysterious and gargantuan creature from another world.

Poets often liken the starry sky to the ocean. They've seen or dreamt of countless bioluminescent plankton floating on a moonless sea, resembling a galaxy, or the moonlight ripped apart by waves on the sea's surface, like shimmering stars. In the most fantastical stories or outrageous lies, the stars found in the depths of the cosmos might be teeming with life, much like Teyvat, and the universe itself is akin to an ocean. Realistically speaking, however, if a profound universe full of life exists, why hasn't any of that life made contact with Teyvat?

Maybe the universe has been constantly trying to infiltrate Teyvat, or maybe a higher power created borders to protect this world.
